Alignment Methods


Global

  • "aligns the entire sequence; align all positions in sequence 1 with sequence 2, there will be mismatches, suitable for similar sequences"

Local

  • "align 2 subsequences; align substrings of each sequence instead of the whole sequence to find highly similar regions"

Dovetail

  • "align opposite ends of sequences; aligns prefix of one sequence with the suffix other sequence"

Pattern

  • "align a complete sequence to a subsequence of another sequence"

Scoring Methods


Edit Distance

  • "Minimum number of operators/mutations (insert, delete, replace) required to transform one sequence into the other"
    "penalty = amount “paid” per mismatch"

Score

  • "match = penalty when the matched letters in the sequence are same, must be 0 or positive"
    "mismatch = penalty when the matched letters in the sequence are not same"
    "insert/delete = penalty to insert a letter from one sequence to the other sequence or delete a letter from one sequence"

BLOSSUM62

  • "BLOSUM is a scoring matrix that shows the relationship between ith and jth letters. In the matrix, positive numbers indicate that mutation between the two letters is likely. The magnitude of the number shows the degree of proximity."

About/Instructions


About

  • "This app is designed to be used as an educational tool to help you learn how the Needleman-Wunsch sequence alignment algorithms work."

Instructions

  • "To start using the app, simply select the initialize button at the top of the actionbar. Enter two sequences of size 6 or less. Select an alignment method (global by default), a scoring method (score by default), an insert/delete cost (-2 by default), a match cost (+1 by default), and a mismatch cost (-1 by default). Then select the “ok” button. An alignment at the top of the page will appear, indicating how the two sequences line up. Below the alignment is a 2D matrix that highlights the traceback path and includes arrows, which indicate where values from the matrix came from."
